_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Computer Process Control System, Vapor Recovery Unit and  Distillation Columns
_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: Fire monitor nozzles for protection of the railcar & tank truck unloading stations as well as the flammable/combustible storage tanks.  Blow-out panels relieve building pressure in event of explosion.
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: High level alarms & High/High Level Switches prevent overfilling of Storage Tanks.
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Various improvements to equipment and technology including upgrade of safety interlocks, pressure relief devices and control system.
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Conservation vent inspection on formaldehyde storage tank

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
er hazardous material, our facility personnel would use chemical-specific response plans and procedures to address the emergency at the earliest stage possible so as to prevent escalation of the incident.

We regularly participate in the activities of the Kalamazoo County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and Disaster Planning Committee.  We work with the KDPS (fire department) to ensure pre-emergency planning and response procedures are coordinated and to provide facility tours to any KDPS personnel that may someday be required to respond to an emergency.

Our fire protection systems, which include signals, alarms and sprinkler protection of all processing areas, are tested regularly.

Facility personnel who may participate in emergency response are provided annual training.


(f.) PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Allnex is constantly striving to upgrade its processes, control technology and employee training, as well as our inspection, repair and maintenance program for process equipment, in order to improve safety and process safety performance.

DESCRIPTION OF THE ALLNEX KALAMAZOO FACILITY

(a.) ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Allnex is a leader among chemical manufacturers in its safety, health and environmental programs.  Our commitment to protect our employees and the communities that are home to our operations is an integral part of Allnex's way of doing business.  Allnex has established safety, health, emergency response and environmental policies and standards to meet or exceed all regulatory requirements.  Allnex has also established a Safety, Health and Environmental management system to ensure the program is maintained and improved on an on-going basis.


(b.) THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Allnex's Kalamazoo, Michigan facility has one process that involves one regulated substance.  The Methylated Resins process makes a product that is a key ingredient in the formulation of coatings for the automotive and other industries, and is used as an adhesive in rubber tire manufacturing.  

(c.) THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

Allnex's general accidental release prevention program includes compliance with:

 -  EPA 40 CFR 68 - Risk Management Plans
 -  OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 - Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals 
 -  MI-OSHA Part 91, Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals
 -  Other EPA, OSHA, DOT and State regulations
 -  Generally recognized and accepted engineering codes and standards, and
 -  Allnex Safety, Health, Environmental and Engineering standards

The process uses a combination of engineering and administrative controls to help prevent releases of the regulated substance.
 
(d.) 5-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no incidents at the Kalamazoo Plant that meet the criteria for reporting in the five-year accident history.
